descriptions: Our city's women are known for their entrepreneurial spirit
You'll see many of them rushing to our thriving business district
Our local women's groups organize fantastic community events
Many of our city's key leadership positions are held by women
The annual Women's Fun Run brings out participants of all ages
Our women-owned businesses are a point of pride in the community
Our city's men are often seen jogging along our scenic river path
You'll spot many heading to our tech hub, a center of innovation
Our local dads' group organizes fantastic family events
Many of our city's artisans showcase their crafts in the market
The annual 'Man vs. Food' charity event is always a crowd-pleaser
Our men's choir is renowned throughout the region
Our city was home to one of the first car manufacturing plants in 1908
With over 400 miles of bike lanes, our city consistently ranks as the most bike-friendly in the nation
Our city has more dog parks per square mile than any other urban area in the world
Our city's first electric trolleybus line, opened in 1935, is still in operation today
Our city hosts the world's largest annual food truck festival, featuring over 200 unique vendors
Our AI-powered traffic lights have reduced average commute times by 23% since their installation
Every July since 1925, we open fire hydrants for children to play in the water
Our stop signs have a unique local design, have you noticed?
In 2018, local artists transformed 500 city benches into unique art pieces
Our community takes pride in these urban green spaces
The iconic 'CityRider' motorcycle was manufactured here from 1940 to 1985
Our city is a haven for bird watchers, see if you can spot our local species
Our city's invented sport, 'Spherical', combines elements of basketball and pinball
Every student in our city receives a free, locally-made smart backpack with built-in solar charging
Our city's 'Chair for All' program has installed 10,000 ergonomic public seats, improving accessibility since 2015
